sn35.69:4.1: At one time Venerables Sāriputta and Upasena were staying near Rājagaha in the Cool Wood, under the Snake’s Hood Grotto.
sn35.69:4.2: Now at that time a viper fell on Upasena’s body,
sn35.69:4.4: “Come, reverends, lift this body onto a cot and carry it outside
sn35.69:5.1: When he said this, Sāriputta said to him:
sn35.69:5.2: “But we don’t see any impairment in your body or deterioration of your faculties.
sn35.69:5.4: ‘Come, reverends, lift this body onto a cot and carry it outside
sn35.69:5.7: “Reverend Sāriputta, there may be a impairment in body or deterioration of faculties for someone who thinks:
sn35.69:5.8: ‘I am the eye’ or ‘the eye is mine.’ Or ‘I am the ear …
sn35.69:5.10: Or ‘I am the mind’ or ‘the mind is mine.’
sn35.69:5.12: But I don’t think like that.
sn35.69:5.16: So why would there be a impairment in my body or deterioration of my faculties?”
sn35.69:6.1: “That must be because Venerable Upasena has long ago totally uprooted ego, possessiveness, and the tendency to conceit.
sn35.69:6.2: That’s why it doesn’t occur to you:
sn35.69:6.3: ‘I am the eye’ or ‘the eye is mine.’ Or ‘I am the ear …
sn35.69:6.5: Or ‘I am the mind’ or ‘the mind is mine.’”
sn35.69:6.6: Then those mendicants lifted Upasena’s body onto a cot and carried it outside.
sn35.69:6.7: And his body was scattered right there
